summary: This document is an email chain from July 8, 2019, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing the final review and approval of a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The chain includes a draft quote from an FBI Assistant Director urging victims to come forward.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the press release and investigation; the FBI quote asks for victims of his alleged criminal behavior to come forward.

events.title: Final Review of Epstein Press Release
events.description: Internal email correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York finalizing a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein and the FBI's call for victims.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was finalizing a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein on July 8, 2019.
The press release included a quote from an FBI Assistant Director urging victims of Epstein's alleged criminal behavior to call 1-800-CALL-FBI.
The FBI's message emphasized that victims should come forward regardless of their current age, age at the time of the incident, or where the incident took place.
The email chain shows coordination between multiple individuals within the office, but all specific names are redacted with the placeholder '(USANYS)'.
The document highlights the ongoing federal investigation into Epstein by the Southern District of New York in July 2019.
